%text Breaking the integrand into partial sums might work.
But it is not the smartest first step.
Notice instead that \[\qquad \frac{d}{dx}(1+x^3) = 3x^2 \]
Hence, if \[z = 1+x^3\], then
%
\begin{align} dz = 3x^2\cdot dx \implies& x^2\cdot dx = \frac{dz}{z} \\ \therefore I = \int\dfrac{x^2}{1+x^3}\cdot dx &= \frac{1}{3}\int\dfrac{dz}{z} \end{align}
